ðŸ“° News we're reading
â€¢ Teen who got 53 college acceptances picked this Alabama university (al.com) â€” Jada-Symone Batichon, a standout senior from Wheeler High School in Powder Springs has chosen the University of Alabama after receiving 53 college acceptances and $1.8 million in scholarships. Her impressive academic and extracurricular achievements made her decision a rewarding one.
Find out what's happening in West Cobbfor free with the latest updates from Patch.
â€¢ WVU hoops guard Chance Moore ruled eligible to play by NCAA, must sit first five games (dominionpost.com) â€” Chance Moore, originally from McEachern High in Powder Springs has been ruled eligible to play for WVU's basketball team, though he must sit out the first five games. His journey through multiple colleges highlights his determination and talent.

- My dog ran out when the kids opened the door.
Her name is wynter. Her home is on Sharon Dr in power springs. Please let me know if you see her. She is chipped ([Nextdoor](https://nextdoor.com/p/gfZWP5mRZ27w/?from_partner=patch&share_id=gfZWP5mRZ27w&utm_medium=public_api&utm_source=patch&utm_content=gfZWP5mRZ27w&next_url=/p/gfZWP5mRZ27w&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=pilot)Sharon) - I lost my Dog today around ship Rd and Florence Rd.
. if you see her please call this number 6784288633. Her name is Sugar.
